mdq:check.name: Resource License Present
mdq:check.description: Check that an entity usage license exists.
mdq:check.code:
def call(): global output global status global datasetLicense
import java.util.ArrayList as ArrayList import metadig.variable as mvar
displayNchars = 40 # A dataset license is not present if 'datasetLicense' not in globals() or datasetLicense is None: output = "A dataset license was not found." status = "FAILURE" return False
datasetLicense = mvar.toUnicode(datasetLicense) if(isinstance(datasetLicense, unicode)): datasetLicense = [datasetLicense]
if (mvar.isBlank(datasetLicense)): output = "The dataset license is blank." status = "FAILURE" return False else: # Check if dataset license is a single string or arrayList if(isinstance(datasetLicense, unicode)): # Create a unicode variable (not byte string) that can contain a unicode result # This won't be needed when Java scripting engine has a compatible Python 3 version outstr = datasetLicense.strip() outstr.replace('\n', ' ').replace('\r', '') if(len(outstr) > displayNchars): outstr = u"{}...".format(outstr[:displayNchars]) output = u"The resource license '{}' was found".format(outstr) elif (isinstance(datasetLicense, list)): outstr = datasetLicense[0].strip() outstr.replace('\n', ' ').replace('\r', '') if(len(outstr) > displayNchars): outstr = u"{}...".format(outstr[:displayNchars]) if(len(datasetLicense) == 1): output = u"The resource license '{}' was found.".format(outstr) else: output = u"The resource license '{}' was found (first of {} licenses).".format(outstr, len(datasetLicense)) else: output = u"The resource license '{}' was found".format(datasetLicense) status = "SUCCESS" return True
